title: How cgroups and Some Kernel Hacks Actually Made Containers
excerpt: Container isn't even a thing in the Linux Kernel. It's just a bunch of clever tricks — cgroups, namespaces, and pivot_root — to make a process feel isolated.

title: Demystifying Java's OOP: A C Programmer's Perspective
excerpt: Coming from a C background, I always found Java's OOP concepts felt like a black box. Here's how the JVM actually implements objects, inheritance, polymorphism, and memory management under the hood.
